TypeSignature.Value: public class PriorityBlockingQueue : Java.Util.AbstractQueue, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Util.Concurrent.IBlockingQueue

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PriorityBlockingQueue extends Java.Util.AbstractQueue implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.IIterable, class Java.Util.Concurrent.IBlockingQueue, class Java.Util.ICollection, class Java.Util.IQueue, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An unbounded that uses the same ordering rules as class and supplies blocking retrieval operations.

remarks.para: An unbounded that uses the same ordering rules as class and supplies blocking retrieval operations. While this queue is logically unbounded, attempted additions may fail due to resource exhaustion (causing OutOfMemoryError). This class does not permit null elements. A priority queue relying on also does not permit insertion of non-comparable objects (doing so results in ClassCastException).

This class and its iterator implement all of the optional methods of the and interfaces. The Iterator provided in method is not guaranteed to traverse the elements of the PriorityBlockingQueue in any particular order. If you need ordered traversal, consider using Arrays.sort(pq.toArray()). Also, method drainTo can be used to remove some or all elements in priority order and place them in another collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Java.Util.IIterator Iterator ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Util.IIterator Iterator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an iterator over the elements in this queue.

remarks.para: Returns an iterator over the elements in this queue. The iterator does not return the elements in any particular order.

The returned iterator is a "weakly consistent" iterator that will never throw , and guarantees to traverse elements as they existed upon construction of the iterator, and may (but is not guaranteed to) reflect any modifications subsequent to construction.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
